title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Sona shareholders back Priya Kapur amid family feud
items.author: Sindhu Bhattacharya, ETAuto
items.summary:
- *Sona BLW* shareholders overwhelmingly approved the appointment of **Priya Sachdev Kapur** as a non-executive director with 99.4% support.
- The AGM proceeded despite *Rani Kapur's* request to postpone it due to alleged irregularities affecting family interests.
- Rani Kapur raised concerns about the ownership structure of *Aureus Investment*, highlighting ongoing tensions within the Kapur family.

items.title: Family Feud Over Sona Comstar Leadership
items.author: Pankaj Doval
items.summary:
- *Rani Kapur* challenges her daughter-in-law's appointment at *Sona Comstar* amid suspicions surrounding her son's death.
- The AGM approved *Priya Sachdev Kapur*'s director position despite Rani's requests for deferment.
- *Sona Comstar* maintains compliance with regulations and denies allegations from Rani, who claims to be a major shareholder based on her late husband's will.

items.title: Role of State Governments in Rare Earth Exploration
items.summary:
- State governments' participation is vital for *India's self-sufficiency* in rare earth exploration and processing.
- Critical minerals are essential for various industries, and India's imports have averaged $33 million annually in recent years.
- The *National Critical Mineral Mission* aims to enhance exploration and reduce dependence on foreign imports, with a funding of ₹18,000 crore allocated for 2025-2031.

items.title: Boeing Workers Threaten Strikes at Fighter Jet Factories
items.summary:
- Members of the *IAM Union* rejected Boeing's contract proposal, risking strikes at fighter jet factories.
- The union represents over *3,200 workers* in Missouri and Illinois, emphasizing the company's offer did not meet their needs.
- If no agreement is reached within a week, a strike could impact Boeing's production significantly, recalling effects from a previous labor walkout.

items.title: India Cautious Amid US Trade Deals Challenges
items.summary:
- India is *cautiously navigating* trade talks with the US due to challenges with recent agreements involving Japan, Indonesia, and Vietnam.
- Japan has disputes regarding its trade deal terms with the US, creating uncertainties in the ongoing negotiations.
- India's commerce minister emphasized that the country won't rush trade deals, prioritizing *national interests* over timelines.

items.title: Garuda Aerospace Expands Drone Exports
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Garuda Aerospace* has secured an **export license** for markets in the *US, Australia,* and the *Middle East*.
- The company aims to export its flagship **Kisan Drone**, focusing on precision agriculture and security applications.
- This marks a significant step in Garuda's global expansion, aligning with India's *Make in India* initiative.

items.title: Amber Group acquires controlling stake in Unitronics
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Amber Group has acquired a *40.24% controlling stake* in Unitronics to enhance *Industry 4.0* solutions.
- The *all-cash deal* worth 156 million NIS aims to integrate Unitronics' expertise in electronics manufacturing.
- This partnership will help Amber strengthen its position in *global markets*, particularly in the rapidly growing automation sector.

items.title: India Inc’s revenue growth moderates to 4-6% in Q1FY26: CRISIL
Calcom Vision Launches Export Subsidiary
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Calcom Vision* has established a new subsidiary, **Calcom Astra Private Limited**, to enhance its export operations in the US and Europe.
- The subsidiary will focus on **exports, sourcing, and vendor development** to adapt to global trade dynamics.
- With projections for India's electronics exports exceeding **$120 billion** by FY26, this move aims to strengthen Calcom's position as a **global electronics manufacturing partner**.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc expands land reclamation efforts in Rajasthan
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
Hindustan Zinc has made significant strides in *land reclamation* in Rajasthan.  
- The company completed Phase 2 of its ecological restoration project, reclaiming a total of **13 hectares** of industrial land.  
- They employed *Mycorrhiza technology* and native planting methods to restore biodiversity, with over **26,000 saplings** planted.  
- Hindustan Zinc's efforts are part of a broader commitment to **sustainable mining** and environmental stewardship.

items.title: Hilti's Vadodara Plant Achieves DGNB Gold Certification
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hilti's Vadodara facility is the *first industrial plant* in India to earn the **DGNB Gold Certification**.
- This certification evaluates buildings throughout their life cycle, focusing on *sustainability*, *economic efficiency*, and *social impact*.
- The plant features innovative systems such as a zero-discharge water system and inclusive design for employee comfort and accessibility.

items.title: Best Manufacturing Events & Conferences in India
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The **best manufacturing events** in India are crucial for networking and innovation in a rapidly evolving sector. 
- Key summits focus on *smart manufacturing*, *aerospace*, and *supply chain logistics*, addressing challenges like sustainability and digital transformation. 
- Attendance at these events offers valuable insights, fosters collaborations, and helps align strategies with national goals like *Make in India*.

items.title: Musk says Samsung will produce Tesla's AI6 chip at US plant
items.summary:
- **Elon Musk** announced that Samsung will manufacture Tesla's next-generation *AI6 chip* at a Texas semiconductor plant.
- The AI6 chip is designed to be scalable for use in *humanoid robots* and *self-driving cars* while also serving AI data centers.
- Samsung received a significant *$16.4 billion* order, marking its largest chip contract ever, boosting its foundry division.

items.title: Vedanta awards ₹865 crores integrated service contract to AESL
items.summary:
- Vedanta has awarded a **₹865 crore integrated service contract** to Asian Energy Services Ltd. (AESL).  
- The contract focuses on *field development* and Operations & Maintenance (O&M) over **57 months**.  
- AESL's MD expressed honor at receiving this contract from *Vedanta*, highlighting O&M as a key growth area for the company.

items.title: US, EU agree on 15% tariff deal to prevent trade war
items.summary:
- The US and EU have reached a **15% tariff deal**, averting a potential trade war. 
- The agreement includes tariffs on automobiles and could influence **$1.7 trillion** worth of trade. 
- EU will invest **$600 billion** in the US and purchase **$750 billion** in energy, promoting economic stability.

items.title: NGT Notices for Tobacco Brands’ Plastic Violations
items.summary:
- The *National Green Tribunal (NGT)* issued notices on alleged violations of the **Plastic Waste Management Rules, 2016** by tobacco product manufacturers.
- Claims include the continued use of banned plastic packaging and calls for strict enforcement of environmental regulations.
- Upcoming hearings are set for *September 26, 2025*, regarding responses from relevant authorities like the **Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB)**.

items.title: India-UK Trade Pact Boosts Chemical Exports
items.summary:
- The **India-UK free trade agreement** allows *over 1,000 chemical product categories* duty-free access to the UK market.
- Current exports to the UK are *$570 million*, but a *30-40% increase* is projected post-agreement, potentially reaching *$750 million* by 2025-26.
- The pact is expected to enhance trade relations, ease market entry, and promote *collaboration and technology transfer*.

items.title: Rangsons Aerospace raises ₹300 crore for expansion
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Rangsons Aerospace* has secured ₹300 crore in funding to enhance its *manufacturing capabilities* and pursue strategic acquisitions.
- The company aims to strengthen its presence in the global supply chain, catering to major industry players like Boeing and ISRO.
- This funding reflects the growing investor interest in India's *aerospace sector*, supporting the government's initiatives for indigenization.

items.title: Sun Pharma, Lupin, Dr Reddy's recall products in US market due to manufacturing issues
South Korea faces risks from US tariff due to reliance on exports,manufacturing
Jabil Invests ₹2,000 Crore in India Manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Jabil* is investing over **₹2,000 crore** in a manufacturing plant in *Sanand, Gujarat*, primarily for silicon photonics and electronics.  
- The plant is nearing completion and will contribute to *domestic manufacturing* and job creation through the **Telecom Production-Linked Incentive Scheme**.  
- With over **300 big brand customers**, Jabil aims to strengthen its position in the *Indian market* while the government supports local value addition.

items.title: Rajoo Engineers Signs Acquisition Offer
items.summary:
- Rajoo Engineers has made a *non-binding offer* to acquire a machine manufacturer to enhance its *product offerings*.
- This strategic move aims to boost its presence in both *domestic and international markets*.
- The acquisition aligns with Rajoo Engineers' vision for *inorganic growth* and forward integration, enhancing end-to-end solutions for customers.

items.title: Nippon Paint launches ‘n-SHIELD’ Paint Protection Films
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Nippon Paint*, Asia Pacific's largest paint manufacturer, has launched its 'n-SHIELD' Paint Protection Films (PPF) in India for automotive surface protection.
- The product line includes gloss, matte, and colored PPF variants, protecting vehicles against UV rays, debris, and impacts.
- The launch supports *Make in India* initiatives, with plans for local manufacturing and a partnership with the *India Champions cricket team* for promotional efforts.

items.title: Sona Comstar appoints Priya Sachdev as non-executive director
items.summary:
- *Priya Sachdev Kapur* has been appointed as a **non-executive director** of Sona Comstar after shareholder approval.
- She is the wife of the late former chairman, *Sunjay Kapur*, who passed away recently.
- This appointment follows corporate restructuring in light of the family's loss, with concerns about legacy and control raised by Sunjay's mother.

items.title: Whisky Business: Non-Tariff Barriers in UK for Indian Liquor
items.summary:
- Indian liquor makers face *non-tariff barriers* in the UK that restrict exports of Indian-Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL).
- Regulatory differences, such as the *minimum maturation period* for whisky, disadvantage Indian producers.
- The CIABC calls for the Indian government to address this *discrimination* and implement a *minimum import price* for Scotch imports.

items.title: Govt efforts to build semiconductor ecosystem in Punjab
items.summary:
- Punjab Chief Minister **Bhagwant Mann** emphasizes the state's commitment to developing a *robust semiconductor ecosystem*. 
- A dedicated *semiconductor park* will be established in Mohali to attract industry investments. 
- This initiative is expected to create significant *employment opportunities* and spur industrial growth in the region.

items.title: Malaysian PM vows to strengthen semiconductor resilience
items.summary:
- **Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim** emphasized the need for Malaysia to strengthen its *semiconductor sector* to withstand external disruptions.
- He highlighted cooperation within **ASEAN** to enhance regional capabilities and eliminate vulnerabilities in the *supply chain*.
- The focus will be on expanding the *engineering workforce* and fostering homegrown technological development while attracting strategic foreign investments.

items.title: Netrasemi Raises ₹107 Crore for Edge AI Chip Development
items.author: Alenjith K Johny
items.summary:
- *Netrasemi*, a semiconductor startup, has secured ₹107 crore from **Zoho** and **Unicorn India Ventures** for developing edge AI chips.
- The funding will enhance their *R&D capabilities* and manufacturing to support sectors like **IoT**, robotics, and smart infrastructure.
- Founded in 2020, Netrasemi aims to launch its product by early 2026, promoting indigenous *intellectual property* in India.

items.title: India Fails to Secure UK Carbon Tax Exemption
items.summary:
- India could not secure an exemption from the UK's upcoming *carbon tax* in a new trade deal, impacting its *carbon-intensive exports*.
- The *Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM)* will impose taxes starting 2027, affecting sectors like steel and aluminum.
- This situation creates a significant *trade imbalance*, prompting India to consider retaliatory measures against the UK.

items.title: Scrapped batteries could power India's lithium boom
items.author: Nimesh Khakhariya
items.summary:
- Researchers at CSMCRI developed a *clean* method to extract lithium from discarded batteries, enhancing India's *lithium self-sufficiency*. 
- This innovative technique achieves 97% lithium leaching efficiency within hours, compared to days using traditional methods. 
- By improving lithium recovery processes, India aims to reduce its *dependency* on imported lithium and promote sustainable battery practices.

items.title: Intel to spin off networking unit under new CEO Tan
items.summary:
**Intel** plans to separate its networking and communications unit into a stand-alone company as part of CEO *Lip-Bu Tan's* strategy to streamline operations and cut costs.  
- This move aims to shed non-core assets and alleviate growing financial pressures.  
- Intel has faced extensive losses amid challenges in the rapidly evolving *AI market*.  
- The networking unit is substantial, generating approximately *$5.8 billion* in revenue, which is 11% of the company's total sales.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh Eyes Strategic Defence Role Post UAV Missile Test
items.author: Samdani MN
items.summary:
- Following a successful UAV missile test, Andhra Pradesh is vying to become a leader in *defence and aerospace manufacturing*. 
- TDP MPs have proposed establishing multiple manufacturing hubs, including missile production and drone units, to attract *defence investments*. 
- Key proposals include setting up a **DRDO industry-academia centre** and an aircraft city, emphasizing extensive land allocations for various projects.

items.title: Mobile PLI creates 1.3 lakh direct jobs till Jun 2025
items.summary:
- The *PLI Scheme* has created **1.3 lakh direct jobs** in mobile manufacturing by June 2025. 
- Cumulative investments amount to ₹12,390 crore, enhancing India's export capabilities, with mobile phone exports rising from ₹1,500 crore to **₹2 lakh crore**.  
- India now ranks as the *second-largest* mobile manufacturing hub globally, transitioning from a net importer to a net exporter of mobile devices.

items.title: Dixon’s JV with Chinese Firm Approved
items.author: Writankar Mukherjee, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Dixon Technologies* receives government approval for a joint venture with *Longcheer Intelligence*.
- This initiative may encourage other Indian firms, such as *PG Electroplast* and *Karbonn Mobile*, to pursue similar ventures with Chinese companies.
- The approval indicates a potential shift in the Indian government's policy towards Chinese investments in the *electronics manufacturing sector*.

items.title: Rare Earth Shortage Impacts Electronics Production
items.author: Subhayan Chakraborty, Dia Rekhi
items.summary:
- A *shortage of rare earth minerals* threatens the **Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS)** targets in India. 
- Companies are considering importing components instead of manufacturing locally due to *supply chain disruptions*. 
- The scheme aims to strengthen domestic production but faces challenges from *China's export limitations* on these critical materials.

items.title: Govt inks ₹2,000 crore deal with BEL for radars
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- The Indian government has signed a deal worth **₹2,000 crore** with **Bharat Electronics Limited** for advanced air defense radars.
- These radars boast a *minimum 70% indigenous content* and are capable of detecting various airborne threats.
- This initiative supports the *Make in India* initiative and significantly enhances the Indian Army's operational capabilities.

items.title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel partners with CSIR-CRRI
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- *ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India* partners with *CSIR-CRRI* to adopt **steel slag road technology**.
- This technology uses processed steel slag aggregates, promoting sustainable *road construction* practices.
- AM/NS India will manufacture and market these aggregates under its brand *AM/NS Aakar*, leveraging advanced processing techniques.

items.title: Sona Comstar rejects Rani Kapur's call to defer AGM
items.summary:
- **Sona Comstar** proceeded with its **AGM** despite a postponement request from **Rani Kapur**, citing compliance and governance norms.
- The company clarified that Rani Kapur has not held shares since 2019 and rejected her allegation of coercion related to document signing.
- Recent governance changes include the appointment of **Jeffery Mark Overly** as Chairman following **Sunjay Kapur's** death, amidst ongoing scrutiny over internal leadership.

items.title: India-UK FTA Opens Fast Lane for Luxury Cars
items.summary:
- The *India-UK Free Trade Agreement* will reduce import duties on British luxury cars from over 100% to 10% over 15 years.
- This change is expected to boost imports of brands like **Jaguar**, **Land Rover**, and **Rolls-Royce**, enhancing accessibility in India.
- The deal also includes a dedicated quota for **electric vehicles**, benefiting both sides and potentially increasing UK auto component exports to India.

items.title: Mobile PLI Creates 1.3 Lakh Jobs by June 2025
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The *PLI Scheme* for mobile production has created **1.3 lakh direct jobs** by June 2025.
- It has attracted **₹12,390 crore** in investment and produced **₹8.44 lakh crore** in goods.
- India transitioned from a **net importer** to a **net exporter** of mobile phones, boosting production significantly.

items.title: ITC to Invest ₹20,000 Cr for Growth
items.summary:
- ITC plans to invest *₹20,000 crore* across businesses to enhance manufacturing and explore growth opportunities. 
- The investment will focus on FMCG, sustainable packaging, and agricultural products, supporting the *ITC Next strategy* for future-ready expansion. 
- ITC's *Food-Tech business* has shown impressive growth, scaling to 60 cloud kitchens with a CAGR of 108% since inception.

items.title: Mobile PLI creates 1.3 lakh direct jobs till Jun 2025: Prasada
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The *PLI Scheme* has resulted in the creation of **1.3 lakh direct jobs** in mobile manufacturing by June 2025.
- Cumulative investment of ₹12,390 crore has been attracted, with production increasing significantly to ₹8.44 lakh crore.
- India has shifted from being a *net importer* to the **second-largest mobile manufacturer** globally, with mobile phone exports soaring 127 times since 2014-15.

items.title: Rajnath Singh to Lay Railway Coach Factory Foundation
items.summary:
- *Defence Minister Rajnath Singh* will lay the foundation for a railway coach factory in *Madhya Pradesh* on August 10. 
- The project, worth Rs 1,800 crore, aims to enhance local industrial growth and create *employment opportunities* for around 1,575 people. 
- Developed in collaboration with BEML, the factory will significantly contribute to the region's economy and job market.

items.title: India likely to gain 5% additional market share in UK
items.summary:
- India is expected to secure an *additional 5% market share* in the UK within 1 to 2 years following a new trade agreement.
- The **Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement** (CETA) will *reduce tariffs on Scotch whisky* and *automobiles*, improving competitiveness.
- Enhanced access for Indian textiles and engineering exports aims to *double exports* to over USD 7.5 billion by 2029-30.

items.title: Mahindra Logistics Leases Space in Pune
items.summary:
- *Mahindra Logistics* has acquired nearly **3 lakh sq ft** of warehousing space in Pune via a **long-term lease** lasting five years.
- The lease includes a rental rate of ₹24 per sq ft with a 5% annual escalation, and the facility will enhance operations in western India.
- This move underscores the increasing demand for *Grade A logistics space* in India’s growing warehousing sector.

items.title: Stitching a Comeback: India’s Textile Trade in the UK
items.summary:
- The *Free Trade Agreement* signed between India and the UK aims to boost India's textile exports significantly, providing *99% duty-free access* for critical items.
- India's textile exports to the UK are currently *only $1.79 billion*, highlighting a substantial *untapped potential* amidst a $27 billion UK import market.
- The FTA is expected to create *new job opportunities* and enhance cooperation between Indian and UK textile industries, while challenges like high cotton prices and outdated manufacturing persist.

items.title: Govt provides ₹49,330 cr fertilisers subsidy till July 21 of FY26
items.summary:
- The Indian government has released a fertilisers subsidy of **₹49,330 crore** as of July 21, 2025-26 to support farmers. 
- A significant portion, **₹30,940.82 crore**, is earmarked for domestic urea, while **₹4,006.70 crore** is for imported urea. 
- The subsidy initiative ensures farmers receive essential nutrients at affordable prices, leveraging the **DBT in Fertilizers** system for efficient distribution.

items.title: UK Deal Boosts Handmade Products Industry
items.summary:
- The *India-UK free trade agreement* will eliminate tariffs on *textiles and apparel*, unlocking opportunities for **handmade products**.
- Heena Patel, founder of **Magic Needles**, emphasizes the importance of *fair trade policies* for boosting global demand and recognition for artisans.
- Government efforts in *export processes* and *funding support* are crucial for expanding *handmade entrepreneurship*.

items.title: India's Semiconductor Vision Gathers Momentum
items.summary:
- India is establishing a robust *semiconductor ecosystem* by leveraging its *20% of the world’s chip design engineers*.
- Initiatives are underway, including *new VLSI Design curriculum* and *85,000 skilled workers* targeted for development in semiconductor design.
- The *Semicon India programme* has an approved outlay of ₹76,000 crore, enhancing infrastructure and catalyzing manufacturing efforts.

items.title: Vedanta Aluminium Expands Foundry Alloy Capacity
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Vedanta Aluminium* has expanded its **Primary Foundry Alloy** capacity at its Jharsuguda SEZ facility by 120 KTPA. 
- This expansion aims to strengthen India's position in the *global automotive aluminium market* and support local manufacturing initiatives like **Aatmanirbhar Bharat**. 
- The company installed modern casting equipment to enhance product quality and meet rising demand for fuel-efficient vehicles.
